comment.author: 64848937@N00
comment._content: A magnificent place to visit if you are only in Dublin for a short time.  It has medieval churches, Celtic High Crosses and Round Towers.  Today the valley is heavily wooded.

comment.author: 78381216@N00
comment._content: This pic would fit very well into the group: www.flickr.com/groups/irish_round_towers/

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: The photographer of this view is Robert French (1841-1917), who was chief photographer for William Lawrence's Photographic Studio in Sackville Street, Dublin. The National Library of Ireland hold the original glass negative in their Lawrence Collection, acquired in 1943 after the firm closed. - catalogue.nli.ie/Record/vtls000325656

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/47201412@N02] -- 
I cannot thank you enough!  Identifying the photographers who took the images published as photochroms is a long-standing dream. There's so much more to be learned from knowing who provided the photos and the other purposes they might have been used for.  Better dates for the image content being one basic aspect.  I'll let trialsanderrors know, too.  (And we'll update our catalog record to add Robert French's name and the link to NLI.)

Very best, Helena (LOC)

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress] No problem Helena. Thanks for your response. I'm pretty confident the majority of the other Irish photochroms in the series will also turn out to be from the Lawrence collection. I'll let the NLI's merry band of Flickroonies know, and I'm sure you'll be peppered with corresponding photos and links.

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress] CLARIFICATION: Correspondence with Carol from the NLI has revealed that the attribution to Robert French as the photographer of this photograph on their catalogue record does not guarantee he was the photographer. Robert French is given as the photographer on each record in the Lawrence Collection by default, on the grounds that there's a 75-80% chance that he did take the photo. - catalogue.nli.ie/Collection/vtls000313414
